content:
Error Handling for Asynchronous Components

Asynchronous components include an optional error variable to give you more control over how to handle specific errors. Use an Apex class and Rule actions to customize the behavior of the Error Handler dialog based on the error variable.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Einstein Bots is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Setup for Einstein Bots is available in Lightning Experience.
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

To use enhanced Messaging channels with Enhanced Bots, view required editions.

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To build and manage Einstein Bots:	
Customize Application

OR

Modify Metadata

OR

Manage Bots

Unlike other messaging components in Einstein Bots, asynchronous components don’t include conversation repair attempts. Instead, these components redirect to the system Error Handler dialog. You can use an Apex class to customize the behavior of the Error Handler dialog.

From the Apex Classes page in Setup, create an Apex class that loops through the list of errors stored in the object list variable and returns the error codes or types.
Add the Apex class to your bot’s Error Handler dialog to make the error codes and types available to your bot.

AVAILABLE ERROR CODES AND TYPES
COMPONENT	ERROR CODES AND TYPES
Authentication	
InvalidAuthenticationRequest
AccessDenied
InvalidScope
AuthenticationRequestExpired
InternalServerError
TemporarilyUnavailable

Form	
InvalidFormResponse
FormRequestExpired
ApiResultErrorCode: When this is the error type, then the errorCode field will contain a Salesforce error code.
InternalServerError

Payment	
ShippingContactInvalid
BillingContactInvalid
AddressUnserviceable
CouponCodeInvalid
CouponCodeExpired
Unknown
title: Error Handling for Asynchronous Components in Service Cloud
